ch.uzh.ifi.csg.cloudsim.rda.useraware

Class UserAwareDatacenter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.SimEntity
      • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.Datacenter
        • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.power.PowerDatacenter
          • ch.uzh.ifi.csg.cloudsim.rda.RdaDatacenter
            • ch.uzh.ifi.csg.cloudsim.rda.useraware.UserAwareDatacenter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class UserAwareDatacenter
extends RdaDatacenter
    This datacenter supports a user aware VM scheduling policy. Before calling the method updateVmsProcessing() on the hosts, this datacenter calls getUserPriorities() on all hosts. This gathers all priorities of the users, so that they can be taken into account when updating the resources for the VMs, running on the different hosts.
    Author:
    Patrick A. Taddei

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserAwareDatacenter

        public UserAwareDatacenter(String name,
                   org.cloudbus.cloudsim.DatacenterCharacteristics characteristics,
                   org.cloudbus.cloudsim.VmAllocationPolicy vmAllocationPolicy,
                   List<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.Storage> storageList,
                   double schedulingInterval)
                    throws Exception
        Instantiates a new user aware datacenter.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the datacenter
        characteristics - an object of DatacenterCharacteristics
        vmAllocationPolicy - the vm provisioner
        storageList - the storage list
        schedulingInterval - the scheduling interval
        Throws:
        Exception - This happens when one of the following scenarios occur:
        • creating this entity before initializing CloudSim package
        • this entity name is null or empty
        • this entity has zero number of PEs (Processing Elements).
          No PEs mean the Cloudlets can't be processed. A CloudResource must contain one or more Machines. A Machine must contain one or more PEs.
